before starting the first square you can see a demonstration of this at the start of the video for panel b link below panel b makes a two-row lace pattern demonstrated here https //youtu be/fk-e8klzahy repeat this square until all the v shapes between the squares are filled loops on lace square retp hook pick up a loop in each single_crochet of the triangle below row 1 8 connect to 1st edge st of adjacent triangle *yarn over *decrease yarn over increase* 3 times row 2 8 pull through connect to next edge st of adjacent triangle 2* until 1 *tss tfs in hole made by yarn over in row 2* 3 times row 3 8 loop connect to next edge st of adjacent triangle remains on row 4 repeat row 2 8 hook row 5 repeat row 3 8 row 6 repeat row 2 8 *single_crochet in tss single_crochet in hole made by yarn over* 3 times slip_stitch in same st as connecting st on bind off row 6 once all squares are completed slip st to the base of the first square to complete the round panel c attach your working yarn to the top point of a square before starting the first square repeat this square until all the v shapes between the squares are filled loops on tunisian simple stitch tss square retp hook pick up a loop in each single_crochet of the square below *yarn over pull row 1 8 connect to 1st edge st of adjacent square through 2* until 1 tss x 6 connect to next edge st of adjacent loop remains on row 2-6 8 square hook bind off single_crochet in top of each tss from row 6 slip_stitch in same st as connecting st on row 6 once all squares are completed slip st to the base of the first square to tunisian full stitch https //youtu be/_tjwg8rpo3m repeat this square until all the v shapes between the squares are filled loops on tunisian full stitch tfs square retp hook pick up a loop in each
